001package io.jstach.rainbowgum.spi;
002
003import java.util.ArrayList;
004import java.util.Comparator;
005import java.util.List;
006import java.util.Map;
007import java.util.Objects;
008import java.util.Optional;
009import java.util.ServiceLoader;
010import java.util.WeakHashMap;
011import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock;
012import java.util.stream.Stream;
013
014import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
015
016import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig;
017import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties;
018import io.jstach.rainbowgum.RainbowGum;
019import io.jstach.rainbowgum.ServiceRegistry;
020
021/**
022 * RainbowGum SPI. The Rainbow Gum SPI uses the {@link ServiceLoader} with the
023 * registration of <strong>this class</strong> and <em>NOT the <code>non-sealed</code>
024 * subclasses!</em> Read the {@link ServiceLoader} doc to understand how to register a
025 * service loader class. A common option is to use an annotation processor to generate the
026 * <code>META-INF/services</code> registration. There are several libraries that can do
027 * this:
028 * <ul>
029 * <li><a href="https://github.com/jstachio/pistachio#serviceloader-helper">Pistachio
030 * SVC</a></li>
031 * <li><a href="https://avaje.io/spi/">Avaje SPI</a></li>
032 * <li><a href="https://github.com/kohsuke/metainf-services">metainf-services</a></li>
033 * </ul>
034 * However if your application is fully modularized (has a <code>module-info.java</code>)
035 * you will need to use the module-info syntax:
036 * {@snippet :
037 *
038 * provides io.jstach.rainbowgum.spi.RainbowGumServiceProvider with com.mycompany.SomeService;
039 *
040 * }
041 * <strong>Initialization Order:</strong>
042 * <ol>
043 * <li>{@link PropertiesProvider}</li>
044 * <li>{@link Configurator}</li>
045 * <li>{@link RainbowGumProvider}</li>
046 * </ol>
047 *
048 */
049@SuppressWarnings("InvalidInlineTag")
050public sealed interface RainbowGumServiceProvider {
051
052        /**
053         * Provides properties and or register services.
054         */
055        public non-sealed interface PropertiesProvider extends RainbowGumServiceProvider {
056
057                /**
058                 * Provides properties and or register services. <em>If just registering services
059                 * and not providing properies an empty list can be returned. </em>
060                 * @param registry registry is usually empty here.
061                 * @return list of properties.
062                 */
063                List<LogProperties> provideProperties(ServiceRegistry registry);
064
065        }
066
067        /**
068         * Providers sometimes need multiple passes to support dependencies without using true
069         * dependency injection.
070         */
071        public enum Pass {
072
073                /**
074                 * First pass.
075                 */
076                FIRST,
077                /**
078                 * Second or greater pass but not the last pass.
079                 */
080                MIDDLE,
081                /**
082                 * The last pass to return true otherwise Rainbow Gum will fail to load. This
083                 * state is useful if a provider can provide a better error by throwing an
084                 * exception.
085                 */
086                LAST;
087
088                static Pass of(int pass, int total) {
089                        if (pass >= (total - 1)) {
090                                return LAST;
091                        }
092                        if (pass == 0) {
093                                return FIRST;
094                        }
095                        return MIDDLE;
096                }
097
098        }
099
100        /**
101         * The default amount of passes made to resolve registrators or configurators.
102         */
103        public static int PASSES = 4;
104
105        /**
106         * Called after {@link LogConfig} has been loaded to do various custom initialization
107         * like registering {@link io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogOutput.OutputProvider}s.
108         * <p>
109         * The configurator has the option to return <code>false</code> to indicate a retry
110         * needs to be made. This is a simple way to handle dependency needs of one
111         * configurator needing another to run prior.
112         *
113         * @see LogConfig#outputRegistry()
114         * @see ServiceRegistry
115         */
116        @FunctionalInterface
117        public non-sealed interface Configurator extends RainbowGumServiceProvider {
118
119                /**
120                 * Do ad-hoc initialization before RainbowGum is fully loaded.
121                 * @param config config.
122                 * @param pass info on what pass this is.
123                 * @return <code>true</code> if all dependencies were found.
124                 */
125                boolean configure(LogConfig config, Pass pass);
126
127                /**
128                 * The default amount of passes made to resolve configurators.
129                 */
130                public static int CONFIGURATOR_PASSES = PASSES;
131
132                /**
133                 * Runs configurators. If a configurator returns false then it will be retried.
134                 * The default of {@value #CONFIGURATOR_PASSES} passes will be tried.
135                 * @param configurators stream of configurators.
136                 * @param config config to use for registration.
137                 * @throws IllegalStateException if there are configurators still returning
138                 * <code>false</code>.
139                 */
140                public static void runConfigurators(Stream<? extends RainbowGumServiceProvider.Configurator> configurators,
141                                LogConfig config) {
142                        runConfigurators(configurators, config, CONFIGURATOR_PASSES);
143                }
144
145                /**
146                 * Runs configurators. If a configurator returns false then it will be retried.
147                 * @param configurators stream of configurators.
148                 * @param config config to use for registration.
149                 * @param passes number of times to retry configurator if it returns
150                 * @throws IllegalStateException if there are configurators still returning
151                 * <code>false</code>.
152                 */
153                private static void runConfigurators(Stream<? extends RainbowGumServiceProvider.Configurator> configurators,
154                                LogConfig config, int passes) {
155                        List<Configurator> unresolved = new ArrayList<>(configurators.toList());
156                        for (int i = 0; i < passes; i++) {
157                                var it = unresolved.iterator();
158                                while (it.hasNext()) {
159                                        var c = it.next();
160                                        if (c.configure(config, Pass.of(i, passes))) {
161                                                it.remove();
162                                                if (c instanceof AutoCloseable ac) {
163                                                        config.serviceRegistry().onClose(ac);
164                                                }
165                                        }
166                                }
167                                if (unresolved.isEmpty()) {
168                                        break;
169                                }
170                        }
171                        if (!unresolved.isEmpty()) {
172                                throw new IllegalStateException("Configurators could not find dependencies (returned false) after "
173                                                + passes + " passes. configurators = " + unresolved);
174                        }
175
176                }
177
178        }
179
180        /**
181         * Implement to create a custom RainbowGum. This is the preferred way to customize
182         * RainbowGum publishers, appenders, and outputs.
183         */
184        public non-sealed interface RainbowGumProvider extends RainbowGumServiceProvider {
185
186                /**
187                 * Optionally provides a rainbow gum based on config.
188                 * @param config config loaded.
189                 * @return a Rainbow Gum or not.
190                 */
191                Optional<RainbowGum> provide(LogConfig config);
192
193                /**
194                 * If there are multiple rainbow gum providers found the higher priority ones are
195                 * tried first ({@link #provide(LogConfig)}). The default is {@code 0}.
196                 * <p>
197                 * This feature allows custom rainbow gums for different environments like a
198                 * testing version that lives in its own jar that is in Maven scope test. If its
199                 * priority is higher and {@link #provide(LogConfig)} returns a non-empty optional
200                 * then it will be used instead of than the production Rainbow Gum.
201                 * @return priority order where higher number means it will be tried earlier.
202                 */
203                default int priority() {
204                        return 0;
205                }
206
207        }
208
209        /**
210         * This is a marker interface that indicates that a facade implementation will do the
211         * eager loading of RainbowGum. This is used to determine if another facade that has
212         * the option to queue should queue and not load rainbowgum if any implementations are
213         * found of this interface.
214         *
215         * @apiNote Only facade implementers need concern themselves with this interface and
216         * for others it is an internal detail.
217         * @see #exists()
218         */
219        public non-sealed interface RainbowGumEagerLoad extends RainbowGumServiceProvider {
220
221                /**
222                 * Without loading service providers will carefully check for the existence of any
223                 * {@link RainbowGumEagerLoad} implementations.
224                 * @return true if something is marked as eager.
225                 */
226                public static boolean exists() {
227                        var sl = ServiceLoaderCache.SERVICE_LOADER_CACHE.findServiceLoader();
228                        return sl.stream()
229                                .filter(p -> RainbowGumEagerLoad.class.isAssignableFrom(p.type()))
230                                .findFirst()
231                                .isPresent();
232                }
233
234        }
235
236        /**
237         * Finds service providers based on type.
238         * @param <T> provider interface type.
239         * @param loader service loader to use.
240         * @param providerType provider class.
241         * @return stream containing only provider of the given type.
242         */
243        public static <T extends RainbowGumServiceProvider> Stream<T> findProviders(
244                        ServiceLoader<RainbowGumServiceProvider> loader, Class<T> providerType) {
245                return loader.stream().flatMap(p -> {
246                        if (providerType.isAssignableFrom(p.type())) {
247                                var s = providerType.cast(p.get());
248                                return Stream.of(s);
249                        }
250                        return Stream.empty();
251                });
252        }
253
254        /**
255         * Creates config from service loader.
256         * @param loader service loader.
257         * @return config.
258         */
259        public static LogConfig provideConfig(ServiceLoader<RainbowGumServiceProvider> loader) {
260                return LogConfig.builder().serviceLoader(loader).build();
261        }
262
263        /**
264         * Will load all RainbowGum SPI to create a RainbowGum powered from the ServiceLoader.
265         * @param loader service loader to use.
266         * @return Rainbow Gum.
267         */
268        public static RainbowGum provide(ServiceLoader<RainbowGumServiceProvider> loader) {
269                var config = provideConfig(loader);
270                @Nullable
271                RainbowGum gum = findProviders(loader, RainbowGumProvider.class)
272                        .sorted(Comparator.comparingInt(RainbowGumProvider::priority).reversed())
273                        .flatMap(s -> s.provide(config).stream())
274                        .findFirst()
275                        .orElse(null);
276
277                if (gum == null) {
278                        gum = RainbowGum.builder(config).build();
279                }
280                return gum;
281        }
282
283        /**
284         * Will load all RainbowGum SPI to create a RainbowGum powered from the ServiceLoader
285         * using the current thread context class loader if avaiable otherwise the system
286         * classloader.
287         * @return Rainbow Gum.
288         */
289        public static RainbowGum provide() {
290                // TODO perhaps we should use RainbowGum.class classloader
291                return provide(cachedServiceLoader(Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader()));
292        }
293
294        private static ServiceLoader<RainbowGumServiceProvider> cachedServiceLoader(@Nullable ClassLoader classLoader) {
295                if (classLoader == null) {
296                        return ServiceLoaderCache.SERVICE_LOADER_CACHE.findServiceLoader();
297                }
298                return ServiceLoaderCache.SERVICE_LOADER_CACHE.serviceLoader(classLoader);
299        }
300
301}
302
303@SuppressWarnings("ImmutableEnumChecker")
304enum ServiceLoaderCache {
305
306        SERVICE_LOADER_CACHE;
307
308        private final Map<ClassLoader, ServiceLoader<RainbowGumServiceProvider>> serviceLoaderCache = new WeakHashMap<>();
309
310        private final ReentrantReadWriteLock lock = new ReentrantReadWriteLock();
311
312        static ClassLoader defaultClassLoader() {
313                // TODO perhaps we should use RainbowGum.class classloader
314                return ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader();
315        }
316
317        ServiceLoader<RainbowGumServiceProvider> serviceLoader(ClassLoader classLoader) {
318                lock.writeLock().lock();
319                try {
320                        var sl = serviceLoaderCache.computeIfAbsent(classLoader, cl -> {
321                                return ServiceLoader.load(RainbowGumServiceProvider.class, classLoader);
322                        });
323                        return Objects.requireNonNull(sl);
324                }
325                finally {
326                        lock.writeLock().unlock();
327                }
328        }
329
330        private @Nullable ServiceLoader<RainbowGumServiceProvider> _findServiceLoader(
331                        @Nullable ClassLoader[] classLoaders) {
332                for (var cl : classLoaders) {
333                        if (cl != null) {
334                                var sl = serviceLoaderCache.get(cl);
335                                if (sl != null) {
336                                        return sl;
337                                }
338                        }
339                }
340                return null;
341        }
342
343        ServiceLoader<RainbowGumServiceProvider> findServiceLoader() {
344                @Nullable
345                ServiceLoader<RainbowGumServiceProvider> loader = null;
346                @Nullable
347                ClassLoader[] classLoaders = new @Nullable ClassLoader[] { Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader(),
348                                ServiceLoaderCache.class.getClassLoader(), defaultClassLoader() };
349                lock.readLock().lock();
350                try {
351                        loader = _findServiceLoader(classLoaders);
352                }
353                finally {
354                        lock.readLock().unlock();
355                }
356                if (loader != null) {
357                        return loader;
358                }
359                return serviceLoader(defaultClassLoader());
360        }
361
362}
